Note: Many other copies occur at end of Love’s prose Mirror, e.g. Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Addit. 6578, f. 124; Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Addit. 6686 [olim Ashburnham 140], p. 233. In Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Ii.4.9 it follows the Northern Passion.
_description: One couplet as conclusion to Wycliffite trans. of St. Bonaventure, Speculum Vite Christi

OxfBras9.Transcription:
Jhesu lorde thy blessid lyfhelpe & conforte oure wrecchid
                    lyf
OxfBras9.Note: End flyleaf; at end of Speculum Vitae.
OxfBras9.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque
                oxoniensibus….
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1852: 2.

OxfUni123.Transcription:
Ihesu lorde þi blesside lifehelpe and counforte oure wrechede
                    life
OxfUni123.Attributed Title:
Speculum Vite Cristi (f. 1); Explicit Speculum Vite cristi
                        complete (follows couplet; f. 74)
OxfUni123.Editions:
Coxe,  Henry Octavius. 
             Catalogus codicum mss. qui in collegiis aulisque
                oxoniensibus….
         Oxon: e Typographeo academico, 1852: 37.
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Popular Prayers in Middle English Verse.” 
             Modern Philology
         36 (1939): 337-50: 348.

BLAdd19901.Transcription:
Jhesu lord þi blessed lifehelpe & confort our wrechede
                    life

BLHar4011.First Lines:
heyle holiest body of oure lorde Ihesu Cristeþat art now
                    sothfast conteyned here in…
BLHar4011.Last Lines:
…departyng þat y may come with þe to life
                    euerlastyngIhesu lord by uertewe & grace of þi life blessid
                    without endyng
BLHar4011.Attributed Title:
A devovte orysoun to þe holy sacrament (f. 2vb, above first
                    line, by scribe)
